Tree-building/dating approach: Sequential Bayesian dating with approximate likelihood (MCMCtree)
Notes: Tree has been rescaled to million years unit, originally it was scaled down by a factor of 100
Some topological constraints applied based on previous literature (B2 constraints set in paper).
Tree topology estimated with total-evidence (molecules + morphology) dataset; 19 species have only morphological data

Tree-building/dating approach: Relaxed Bayesian clock + grafting on backbone tree (RAxML + BEAST2)

Notes: Tree has been rescaled to million years unit, originally it was scaled down such as that its height was equal to 1; tips represent clustering of sequence pool including undescribed species and environmental samples, as well as described species

This tree looks a bit weird, it has huge 'rakes' of many species diverging in a super short time (almost like artificially resolved polytomies): probably it is not ideal for the analysis of branch lengths over time

Tree-building/dating approach: Relaxed Bayesian clock + grafting on backbone tree (BEAST2)
Notes: Relative timetrees for each family estimated and then grafted on a backbone; absolute time tree produced with just few taxa per family

Tree-building/dating approach: Relaxed Bayesian clock on fixed topology plus taxonomic grafting (EML-RAxML + MrBayes + PASTIS)
Notes: 4061 species have molecular data, 3177 species only have taxonomic assignment

Tree-building/dating approach: Gene tree estimation => IQ-TREE species tree estimation => divergence time estimation using treePL
Notes: High genus coverage (92%), not so high species coverage. Taxa are sampled with the aim of covering the higher taxonomic diversity

Tree-building/dating approach: Relaxed Bayesian clock with ML-informed topological constraint (RAxML + BEAST2)
Relaxed Bayesian clock on fixed topology (RAxML + BEAST)
Notes: Not all tips are recognized species, 82 of them are currently classified as subspecies

Tree-building/dating approach: Relaxed Bayesian clock with ML-informed topological constraint (RAxML + BEAST2)
Notes: Nodes with > 0.9 bootstrap support in RAxML tree are fixed in the BEAST2 analysis

Tree-building/dating approach: Relaxed(?) Bayesian clock on fixed topology (RAxML + BEAST)
Notes: Gnetophyta, a bizarre group with around 70 species not included in this study, could potentially cluster within Pinophyta (the clade considered here) as sister to Pinales

1015 tips (59%) have molecular data associated with them. It is not entirely clear how the remaining species have been grafted into the tree: "implementing topological constraints from previous phylogenomic studies of smaller clades"

Tree-building/dating approach: Relaxed Bayesian clock on fixed topology (BEAST)

Version 1.4.0 of the Fern Tree of Life

Notes: Age constraints for penalized likelihood taken from relaxed Bayesian clock analysis (BEAST2) with only few taxa

Tree-building/dating approach: Fixed Bayesian local clocks + grafting on fixed backbone tree (RAxML + ASTRAL + BEAST)
Notes: "Metachronogram" approach; less than 100 tips might actually represent taxa below the species level
Not all tips are recognized species, but number of subspecies is not specified in the paper
Weirdly, posterior probabilities and age uncertainties are not present in the file, contrary to usual BEAST output

Tree-building/dating approach: Relaxed Bayesian clock on fixed topology (RAxML + BEAST)
Developed PyPHLAWD to analyse subtrees and merge together. Maximum likelihood (RAxML) and Penalized likelihood (treePL) used within subtrees.
Notes: This procedure resulted in two comprehensive seed plant phylogenies: one with the deep branches resolved according to Magallón et al. (2015) and one with the deep branches resolved according to the Open Tree of Life release 9.1. GenBank taxa with a backbone provided by Magallón et al. (2015) (GBMB).
Notes 2: Tree is not binary. Needs to fix this before used in analysis. Source

Notes: align_w_shtest_treepl_3samp.tre = maximum likelihood tree with divergence time estimation and 3 minimum samples

Notes: Two calibration scenarios are used in the paper. This is the resulting tree for calibration scenario #1
